item.title: 8 Resident Evil Characters Who Went Rogue
item.description:
Summary

  • Sherry Birkin defied her orders from Simmons after realizing his true intentions.
  • HUNK became a mercenary after Umbrella's fall, known for his survival skills.
  • Characters like Krauser chose power and solo ambitions over alliances.

When a zombie outbreak suddenly kicks off out of nowhere, as is very common in the world of Resident Evil , most people will usually try and stay with a larger group to have the best shot at survival, but this doesn't always last. In fact, there have been several characters who, despite possibly being in a team in the past, eventually decided to go rogue, abandoning their position to chase their own goals and ambitions.

On the one hand, this can make someone extremely dangerous, since it's never easy to predict what their intentions are, and whether they're even trustworthy in the first place. Then again, in a world where people are always trying to backstab one another to save their own skin, maybe these characters decided to abandon their position for their own safety? Either way, it's time to take a look at the Resident Evil characters who, at some point in the series, have gone rogue to uncover what exactly prompted them to do so.

8 Sherry Birkin

After Realizing The True Intentions Of Simmons, Sherry Disobeys His Orders

Resident Evil 6
6 /10
6.3 /10
Released
October 2, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS3, PS4, Xbox 360, Xbox One, PC, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Weak
Powered by

Sherry may have been only a child when she debuted in Resident Evil 2 , but once she returned to the sixth mainline game, she's all grown up and a loyal member of the DSO working under a man named Simmons. Though Sherry follows Simmons' orders for much of the game, once she meets Leon a little later, she comes to learn that the director isn't all that he seems and has actually been pulling a lot of the strings from behind the scenes to enact his own selfish plan for him and 'The Family'.

As a result, while Sherry was initially instructed to bring Jake in due to his affiliation with Wesker, she would instead decide to team up with him, so that the two could make their grand escape. She may have been a timid and naive young girl all those years ago, but these days, Sherry is more than willing to stand up for herself if she's being treated unfairly.

7 HUNK

After The Fall Of Umbrella, HUNK Decided To Become A Dangerous Mercenary

4 Images
4 Images
Resident Evil 2
9 /10
9.3 /10
Released
January 21, 1998

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Violence
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
Sega Dreamcast, Nintendo 64, Nintendo GameCube, PC, PS1
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

HUNK is Umbrella's most valuable asset, or at least he was, until the company went bust in 2003 after the stock crash. Because HUNK is barely ever seen in the series, it can make it a little hard at times to deduce what exactly he is up to, but thanks to a few documents and external information, what has been made clear is he is seemingly traveling around as a mercenary who even created his own fighting style which he calls CQBF.

Considering HUNK has earned the nickname of Grim Reaper due to his tendency to embark on suicide missions and survive, there's no doubt he's taken down a plethora of infected humans and mutants since he separated from Umbrella. Fans can only hope to see this mysterious figure in a future installment of the series, though it seems likely with how popular he is.

6 Jack Krauser

Krauser's Hunger For Power Drove Him Down A Dark Path

5 Images
5 Images
Resident Evil 4
7 /10
21
9.3 /10
Released
January 11, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, PS2, Xbox One, Xbox 360, Switch, Wii, Nintendo GameCube, PC, Android, iOS
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

It can be hard to believe, considering the two are literally trying to kill one another in Resident Evil 4 , but Leon and Krauser were actually once close allies. In the Darkside Chronicles game, specifically the Operation Javier campaign, players can see that Leon and Krauser had a very close mentor and student relationship, but when the mission went horribly wrong, resulting in Krauser being severely injured and Leon saving the day, the former of the two started to lose his mind.

Krauser, feeling rejected by the U.S Government and obtaining an unhealthy obsession with growing more powerful, would fake his death and seek out someone who could make him more powerful. Though he did eventually end up meeting Wesker and Saddler, it's clear Krauser always puts his own ambitions first and was willing to go rogue for quite a while until he found the people he was looking for.

5 Zoe Baker

Zoe Isolated Herself From Her Family To Avoid Eveline's Influence

Resident Evil 7: Biohazard
12
9.0 /10
Released
January 24, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Switch, Stadia, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

It wasn't long after the Baker family took in a young girl named Evelyn that they began to become more restless and violent. The truth is, Evelyn was secretly a B.O.W. who had been molding the Bakers into her own makeshift family, transforming them into a bunch of crazed lunatics who were hell-bent on killing anyone in sight, but one member of the family who decided to reject this way of thinking was Zoe.

In fact, Zoe would choose to isolate herself from her family by living in the trailer, which can be found outside the Baker Estate. Instead of giving in to Evelyn's temptations, Zoe decides to help out Ethan as a way to rebel against everything that had happened to her loved ones.

4 Chris Redfield

Years Of Constant Fighting Had Taken Its Toll On Chris

Resident Evil 6
6 /10
6.3 /10
Released
October 2, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS3, PS4, Xbox 360, Xbox One, PC, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Weak
Powered by

Most of the time, the legendary protagonist Chris Redfield is usually partnered up with some sort of organization, whether it be STARS, the BSAA, or even Blue Umbrella. There was, however, a brief period where Chris decided to abandon his post altogether after years of fighting against bioterror finally took its toll on him, and this can be seen at the beginning of Resident Evil 6 , where Chris is drinking away his sorrows in a bar.

After Pierce, an up-and-coming BSAA soldier, decides to intervene, he talks about how much Chris has fallen from grace and that the BSAA needs him to return in order to handle yet another mission. In Resident Evil 5 , Chris would again disobey his orders so that he could embark on a personal mission to rescue Jill. Chris is usually as loyal as they come, but he is still human after all and can sometimes let his emotions get the better of him when the going gets tough.

3 Luis Serra

Luis Was Once A Key Researcher For The Los Illuminados

5 Images
5 Images
Resident Evil 4
7 /10
21
9.3 /10
Released
January 11, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, PS2, Xbox One, Xbox 360, Switch, Wii, Nintendo GameCube, PC, Android, iOS
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

When Leon first runs into Luis near the beginning of Resident Evil 4 , it's clear that the wisecracking local has something to hide. Though he often enjoys talking in riddles, Luis is eventually forced to admit that he was once a researcher for Saddler and the Los Illuminados, which is why he's being hunted down by the cult and is in a similar situation to Leon and Ashley.

To try and make up for his past sins, Luis does all he can to support the duo along their adventure, even providing them with supplements to hold back their infection until they can get cured. Going rogue was certainly risky considering Luis is severely underprepared to take on Saddler's army, but he still proves to be an extremely useful ally to Leon in the end.

2 Albert Wesker

Wesker Abandoned Umbrella To Achieve His Lofty Goals

Resident Evil HD Remaster
7 /10
6.0 /10
Released
January 20, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Violence, Blood and Gore, Language
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox 360, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

In the first Resident Evil game, players are led to believe that Wesker is the leader of the STARS team who stumble into the zombie-infested Spencer Mansion, but this isn't exactly the whole truth. At this point in time, Wesker was actually working under Umbrella and was disguising himself as a member of STARS in order to gain more data on the B.O.Ws that resided in the building. After being unexpectedly stabbed by a Tyrant and brought back to life, Wesker decided that it was best to fake his death and embark on his own ventures without the organization dragging him down any longer.

Over the next few games, Wesker would dip in and out of several organizations in order to get what he needed to execute his grand plan. In Resident Evil 5 , for example, despite it seeming like Wesker teamed up with the organization known as Tricell, he essentially just became their leader and discarded them as soon as his Uroboros virus was ready to go. Simply put, Wesker is a lone wolf who can only depend on himself.

1 Carlos Oliveira

Umbrella's Involvement In The Raccoon City Incident Encouraged Carlos To Leave

Resident Evil 3
7 /10
8.4 /10
Released
April 3, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Though the Umbrella organization is often presented as an evil corporation within the series, not everyone who works under them is evil; a prime example of this is Carlos. Carlos had no idea Umbrella was behind the Raccoon City Outbreak, though he would eventually come to learn what was actually going on after he traveled to the city hospital to try and cure Jill.

During his rescue mission, he was shocked to uncover the dirty deeds that Umbrella had committed, and though he couldn't exactly officially step down considering everything that was going on at the time, he made it pretty clear he had no interest in working with them any longer. External material and in-game files make it clear that Umbrella was very adamant that everyone in the city should be killed to avoid any information being leaked, so the fact that Carlos was willing to protect and even save Jill's life already made him a traitor.

item.title: Best Games With Base-Building & Combat
item.description:
Summary

  • Kenshi offers freedom in goal-setting, featuring RPG elements with optional combat and base-building.
  • V Rising combines action RPG combat with castle-building, offering impressive boss battles and base customization.
  • Cult Of The Lamb blends colony-sim and dungeon-crawler, providing addictive gameplay with synergistic combat and base-building.

There are many games that allow players to build structures and develop entire bases to varying degrees. From the typical base-building of real-time strategy games such as StarCraft 2 to the creative offerings of titles like Minecraft , there are a variety of base-building experiences on the market.

However, these games don't always feature combat. In addition, those that feature both don't always combine the two in interesting ways. These games, however, feature both base-building and combat, and the best of them blend each element in synergistic ways.

7 Kenshi

A Tough & Slow-Burning Sandbox

Kenshi
10.0 /10
Released
December 6, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
nr
Developer(s)
Lo-Fi Games
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Kenshi is an open-world sandbox RPG with an abundance of activities and an emphasis on player agency. In the game, players are given complete freedom to set and explore their own goals. This allows for bounty-hunting, trading, and even base-building.

The detailed RPG systems, methodical combat, and party management allow for diverse gameplay. Best of all, while Kenshi does feature combat and base-building, both are somewhat optional. That said, players will more than often be forced to contend with the world's many dangers in some way.

6 V Rising

An Action RPG With Castle-Building

V Rising
8.9 /10
Released
May 17, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Stunlock Studios
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

V Rising is a slick and stylish action RPG that combines frequent combat encounters and impressive boss battles with expressive base-building. In the game, players take on the role of a vampire in an open world, exploring Gothic locations across a variety of environments as they attempt to defeat myriad bosses.

The slick action is a particular strength, but V Rising features both combat and base-building. The base-building features a variety of options, ultimately allowing players to construct impressive castles to call home. This multi-faceted design results in a diverse and satisfying loop that can be enjoyed in single-player or in online co-op.

5 Cult Of The Lamb

A Blend Of Colony-Sim & Dungeon-Crawler

Cult of the Lamb
8 /10
10
9.0 /10
Released
August 11, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Rated T for Teen for Blood, Violence.
Developer(s)
Massive Monster
Platform(s)
Switch, PS4, Xbox One, PS5, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Cult Of The Lamb is an innovative combination of roguelite dungeon-crawlers and colony-sims. In the game, players take control of a burgeoning cult, working to grow its ranks in order to unlock new zones and upgrade their abilities.

The colony-sim gameplay of Cult Of The Lamb is relatively simple, streamlined, but it blends perfectly with the accompanying dungeon-crawls and offers an addictive flow. As a result, Cult Of The Lamb manages to offer combat and base-building that are both satisfying and synergistic.

4 Dune: Spice Wars

4X Base-Building & RTS Combat

6 Images
6 Images
Dune: Spice Wars
Real-Time Strategy
Systems
Released
September 14, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen // Fantasy Violence, Drug Reference
Developer(s)
Shiro Games
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Dune: Spice Wars is a slow-paced and methodical RTS that borrows heavily from 4X design to offer players a unique experience. Every game of Dune: Spice Wars is heavily focused on acquiring and efficiently managing territory.

Each territory features a base that can be expanded upon, and also comes with traits that can be exploited with specific structures. This puts a heavy emphasis on base-building, but Dune: Spice Wars also features real-time combat that can be particularly deadly thanks to the addition of attrition mechanics and the iconic sandworms.

3 Thronefall

An Intuitive Blend Of RTS & Tower Defense

Thronefall
Strategy
City Builder
Systems
Released
October 11, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ // Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
GrizzlyGames
Platform(s)
PC, Nintendo Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Though it takes a minimalist approach to design, Thronefall is a feature-rich experience that blends both combat and base-building in intuitive ways. In the game, players develop and defend a miniature kingdom against waves of enemies via a combination of defensive structures and units.

In addition to the blend of RTS combat and tower defense base-building, Thronefall also allows players to navigate each level with their own character and even partake in battle. This allows for a diverse gameplay loop that deftly blends combat with base-building and even light economy management.

2 RimWorld

A Colony-Sim With Lethal Combat

RimWorld
8.7 /10
Released
October 17, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Use of Drugs, Violence
Developer(s)
Ludeon Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

RimWorld is a deep and rich management game that tasks players with the development of a small colony on a wildly dangerous planet. The game features a complex combination of mechanics and systems that make it difficult at first, but its effortless blend of base-building, management, and lethal combat encounters makes it a rewarding experience overall.

Combat isn't RimWorld's primary focus, but it is a frequent enough occurrence to be meaningful. In addition, the security and layout of the player's base can have a tremendous impact on combat. Additionally, how well players manage their colonists can have an effect on their efficiency during encounters.

1 StarCraft 2

A Fast-Paced Sci-Fi RTS

StarCraft 2
8 /10
9.2 /10
Released
July 27, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Developer(s)
Blizzard
Platform(s)
PC, macOS
Powered by

StarCraft 2 is a slick real-time strategy game that offers a tremendously polished take on the genre's patented blend of base-building and army management. Economy, unit production, and unit control are all important factors in a game of StarCraft 2 , and this results in incredibly diverse gameplay.

Additionally, StarCraft 2 features three asymmetric factions that are wildly different from one another. Each of these factions offers unique strengths and weaknesses within both base-building and combat, allowing for a diverse and expressive experience that's consistently rewarding.

item.title: 9 Games That Explore The Theme Of Isolation
item.description:
Summary

  • Isolation in games offers unique, emotional experiences through loneliness and quiet atmospheres.
  • Games like Limbo and Journey emphasize emotional depth and storytelling over action.
  • Titles like Everyone's Gone to the Rapture and Soma explore isolation in eerie, haunting settings to provoke deep reflection.

Some of the most memorable gaming moments arent about fighting or exploring big maps, but about calmer scenes, total silence, and feeling entirely alone. Since the gaming industry emphasizes action and entertainment, titles about being alone tend to impress players with their true-to-life emotions and atmosphere.

Isolation in many forms such as physical, emotional, or psychological has interested video game creators for years. It eliminates extra distractions, so players only concentrate on the game world, their characters mental state, and the forgotten stories in empty places. These kinds of games tend to be slower and more thoughtful, leaving a stronger impression on player minds than action-packed scenes do. Those who enjoy being alone will find these games offer unique stories that make them reflect and feel various emotions.

Spoiler Warning: Some entries below hint at story spoilers and narrative developments in their respective games.

1 Limbo

A Haunting Journey Through the Unknown

Limbo
9 /10
8.3 /10
Released
July 21, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Playdead
Publisher(s)
Playdead
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PS Vita, Switch, PC, Android, iOS
Powered by

Limbo takes the player through a moody, black-and-white world where the main character searches for his sister. Without any spoken dialogue or set challenges, all players find are dark passages, sneaky traps, and a lingering sense of dread. Since the world is missing color and sound, the loneliness grows, with every second feeling unsteady and unreliable.

When tasks take place in the dark and abandoned ruins of Limbo , the game brings out loneliness in players, which is rarely explored in other games to this same level. While the game is fairly short, its enduring impact lasts for a long time after rolling credits.

2 Firewatch

Exploring Grief & Self-Isolation Peacefully?

Firewatch
9 /10
8.5 /10
Released
February 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Campo Santo
Publisher(s)
Campo Santo, Panic
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Switch, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Henry, the main character in Firewatch , is shown taking the position of a fire lookout located well away from civilization. His entire connection is with a woman on the radio Delilah and their dialogues go from simple to deeply emotional. Henrys isolation on his own often creates the tone throughout the game.

The peaceful yet lonely settings in the game are made to show Henrys emotional distance from others. While searching for answers, gamers must also focus on the characters loneliness and what stains their past. Much of what makes Firewatch interesting are the things that are left unsaid.

3 Journey

A Metaphorical Trek Through Inner Solitude

Journey
8 /10
9.4 /10
Released
March 13, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Thatgamecompany
Publisher(s)
Sony
Platform(s)
PS3, PS4, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Journey seems to be one of the most poetic portraits of being alone in games. Players use their characters abilities to explore a gigantic desert and reach a distant mountain summit. The place looks bare, with ruined buildings hinting at a time when people lived here. All the experience comes from images and musical soundtracks, since there is no dialogue to speak of.

Another silent character appears from time to time, which makes the story more emotional. Although players can encounter these travelers throughout their journey, they are unable to communicate with them using ordinary methods. It highlights the quiet sense of happiness and isolation that come from spending time with others.

4 Death Stranding

Reconnecting A Fragmented, Isolated World Through Connections

Death Stranding
4 /10
25
7.7 /10
Released
November 8, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Kojima Productions
Publisher(s)
Sony, 505 Games
Platform(s)
iOS, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Hideo Kojimas Death Stranding shows an original approach to the way human relationships develop in a broken world. Playing Sam Porter Bridges, players deliver goods across a ruined America as they pass through scary places and encounter supernatural enemies. A large proportion of the game has players exploring mountains, rivers, and uncrowded cities by themselves.

Even though being alone is a strong feeling, the game aims to remind players how important it is to connect with others. Due to the asynchronous multiplayer design, other players' structures will appear in the world, helping players progress simply by existing. There is a unique atmosphere players are by themselves, but they are still connected in some way. Its loneliness that, ultimately, makes players hope for change.

5 Everybodys Gone To The Rapture

A Town Empty, Yet Full Of Presence

Everybody's Gone to the Rapture
9 /10
10.0 /10
Released
August 11, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Publisher(s)
Sony Computer Entertainment
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

The setting, which is a peaceful English village where everything and everyone has vanished, contributes to the games loneliness. Directing their focus on the deserted town, players put together stories about the past residents using clips of old speeches and light trails. There are no battles or typical gamey activities it all unfolds in a slow and thoughtful manner.

The peaceful beauty of the countryside against the abandoned village gives the video game an interesting and mysterious feel. Players also feel isolated emotionally in Rapture because they witness episodes of love, loss, and miscommunication as the town faces an unfamiliar threat.

6 SIGNALIS

A Lone Journey Through Synthetic Despair

Signalis
9.3 /10
Released
October 27, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Microsoft Windows, Xbox Series X/S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

SIGNALIS puts old-school mechanics into a driving narrative of sci-fi horror. The game puts players in the shoes of a Replika as they go through a ruined building on an isolated planet. The bleak visuals, the mystical story, and the haunting audio design of the game create a great sense of loneliness for players.

While the protagonist moves further into the story, feelings of loneliness become a mental struggle. Disconnected memories, warped ideas, and an uneasy feeling make up a story that speaks to the player. It shows how identity and loneliness affect people living in a damaged environment.

7 Outer Wilds

Wonder and Isolation Go Hand in Hand

Outer Wilds
9.2 /10
Released
May 28, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Mobius Digital
Publisher(s)
Annapurna Interactive
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

In Outer Wilds , players are put into a solar system that keeps repeating, stuck in a time loop. As an astronaut-explorer, players are in charge of discovering the secrets of the past and the unknown forces in the unique solar system. The feeling of being alone is bigger than physical loneliness; it also deals with the ideas of time and the meaning of existence.

In spite of being colorful and whimsical, the game leaves players feeling very solitary. Finding hidden secrets on abandoned planets and seeing how big the universe is makes the Outer Wilds especially touching.

8 Nier: Automata

Existential Loneliness Hidden Behind Combat

NieR: Automata
10 /10
9.1 /10
Released
March 7, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Platinum Games
Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Despite having fantastic action and various NPC events, Nier: Automata keeps reminding the player that they are by themselves. The journey of 2B, 9S, and A2, seeing the dark side of a ruined world, urges players to consider their own purpose, nature, and emotions. There is nothing to create joy, and the survivors are surrounded by coldness.

This experience gets more intense in the third playthrough, with important truths about humanity being exposed. It revamps the players view on the story and makes the feeling of being alone and without hope even stronger. Nier s loneliness comes from noticing that not much is left out there.

9 Soma

Loneliness Amplified By A Philosophical Crisis

SOMA
8 /10
9.8 /10
Released
September 15, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Frictional Games
Publisher(s)
Frictional Games
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Soma is set in an underwater research station and shares psychological horror stories with players. Because people seldom interact, and the environment is slowly dying, the video game is chock-full of dread. However, its the philosophical elements that make its isolation stick with the audience.

When players learn about consciousness and try to survive, they come across moral questions that point out just how lonely people can feel. This game not only keeps players from human contact it prompts them to deliberate their very existence.

item.title: What Dune: Awakening Reveals About Player Psychology in Harsh Worlds
item.description:
Dune: Awakening may present itself as a survival MMO, but it often feels like something closer to a psychological experiment. From the moment players complete the game's tutorial sequence and step out onto the open sands of Arrakis, they're likely to feel the pressure begin to build and mental exhaustion gradually setting in. This is because Dune: Awakening 's survival mechanics aren't just punishing for the sake of realism and challenge, but are relentless by design. In turn, that relentlessness reveals how people handle discomfort, the unknown, and the absence of clear direction.

That's where Dune: Awakening 's real identity begins to surface. Playstyles are not rewarded here or even demanded. Instead, Dune: Awakening prefers to sit back and simply observe. Faced with constant danger and no promise of stability, players lean into their instincts, not for strategic purposes, but simply to survive. Whether it's through thorough preparation, taking impulsive risks, or building relationships with other players, those responses paint a clearer picture of the player than even Dune: Awakening 's character creator is capable of.

Dune: Awakening Turns Survival Into a Psychological Mirror

Stress and Survival Blend to Form a Behavioral Sandbox

In Dune: Awakening , survival isn't something that comes and goes. Instead, it constantly lingers somewhere between the background and the foreground, offering few breaks from danger and death. Dehydration, Sunstroke, quicksand, and the ever-present threat of Dune: Awakening 's sandworms make every step across the desert feel like a massive risk, and even when players are standing still, the clock is working against them. Ultimately, this pressure doesn't just affect how one plays the game, but it changes their approach to the game altogether.

Every journey in Dune: Awakening is a mental trial where the sun, storms, and sandworms are just as much an enemy as another player. Within this space, the game becomes something more psychological in nature. Some players try to control the chaos by over-preparing, sticking close to the shade, or building massive bases that make them feel safe. Others might do the opposite, charging into the unknown with minimal supplies just to see if they can survive the odds. There's no reward for approaching it one way or another, only a revelation about the unique ways that players think when they're dropped into a harsh environment.

Players Reveal More About Themselves Than the World Does

MMOs like Dune: Awakening are always about a shared world with other players, but any relationships formed in Funcom's latest rarely come from casual conversation or fun emotes. Instead, they come from exhaustion. In Dune: Awakening , most players link up because surviving alone wears them down. Resource scarcity, environmental stress, and the constant need to stay on the move push people into groups, not necessarilyi out of friendship, but out of convenience. Traveling together means staying alive a little longer, which means it's less about forming bonds and more about staying above ground.

Every journey in Dune: Awakening is a mental trial where the sun, storms, and sandworms are just as much an enemy as another player.

Even base-building reflects that mindset. Players in the Deep Desert build what's necessary rather than some glamorous monument to show off, knowing full well that it won't last Dune: Awakening 's server wipes. Decay is built into the system, so every base is more of a temporary pit stop than a lasting stronghold. In fact, Dune: Awakening shies away from anything permanent, putting even more stress on players to plan accordingly. To some, that lack of permanence might demoralize them enough to see them not making any progress at all, whereas it might push others to do even more.

In the end, Dune: Awakening isn't trying to tell players who to be or how to play. Rather, it's trying to show them who they already are. Its harshness acts like a mirror, revealing each player's capacity for control, cooperation, challenge, or surrender. By largely removing structure and the comfort that accompanies most MMOs, Dune: Awakening pushes players to the point of exhaustion and becomes something of a psychological experiment that can be a bit of a thrill ride to experience.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: 8 Scariest Ghosts From Horror Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Phasmophobia's Deogen ghost hunts its prey relentlessly with uncanny accuracy and will send chills down players' spines.
  • Resident Evil 7's Remy Baker ghost appears as an unsettling apparition in the demo.
  • Visage's Lucy, despite dying tragically, is a haunting figure with a jawless appearance that heightens her horror.

Ghosts are something that have haunted media such as books, movies, and games for decades. These spirits of the dead often linger in anger or sadness for those that wronged them when they were still alive, but woe betide any who cross their deadly path.

With a wealth of horror games on the market, there are undoubtedly countless ghosts haunting them, ready to terrify the players to their own grave, as most are defenseless against these incorporeal beings. These are the most frightening ghosts players could ever have the misfortune of meeting.

8 Deogen (Phasmophobia)

This Ghost Always Knows the Location of Its Prey

Phasmophobia
10.0 /10
Released
October 29, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Use of Drugs, Violence
Developer(s)
Kinetic Games
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Hunting ghosts is the aim of the game here, as up to four hunters enter a premise said to be haunted, equipped with gear which helps to narrow down what entity they could be dealing with, but there are great dangers to this profession, as the hunters could become the hunted. These locations are dark and overbearingly creepy, which makes trying to gather evidence a true test of courage, especially if one of the hunters dies.

When dealing with the Deogen, death is almost more of an inevitability rather than a possibility, as this ghost always seems to know the exact locations of the players, so it knows exactly where to head when the hunt begins. Phasmophobia is already a frightening enough game, but it becomes almost heart-stoppingly petrifying when this ghost comes out to play. Even if the Deogen slows down once it's close enough, players will already be hiding, thus making themselves cornered and dead.

7 Remy Baker (Resident Evil 7: The Beginning Hour)

Though Axed from the Full Game, Her Presence in the Demo Was Keenly Felt

Resident Evil 7: Biohazard
12
9.0 /10
Released
January 24, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Switch, Stadia, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Before Resident Evil 7 was released, Capcom released the Beginning Hour, a demo which differed from the main game, even though a similar tape appeared. The player character wakes up alone in what seems to be an abandoned farmhouse, with night quickly drawing to a close, and their only objective is to get the hell out of dodge. Finding tapes scattered throughout, which seem to be shot by a paranormal investigation show, he follows their steps in hopes it might lead to an escape.

Though Jack Baker features as the main antagonist, eagle-eyed players might spot several apparitions throughout the demo, dubbed as the Ghost Girl by those fans who spotted her, her true identity being a scrapped character by the name of Remy. The fact that most of her sightings are just split second glances in the background is chilling, as it brings into doubt whether the player actually saw her or not, and by the time they can take a second look, she is gone, and players don't know when or where she might reappear, but most won't mind as long as it is far, far away.

6 Lucy (Visage)

Lucy's Appearance is Nothing Short of Unsettling

Visage
Horror
Systems
Released
October 30, 2020
ESRB
m
Developer(s)
SadSquare Studio

Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Visage certainly doesn't ease players into the horrors, as it opens with the grizzly scene of player character Dwayne Anderson awakening in a room soaked in the blood of his family, whom he shot and killed himself. From there, he steps from nightmare to nightmare, encountering other unfortunate ghosts who died under horrifying circumstances.

All of the ghosts are terrifying, but no ghost can beat the ghost of a little girl, as they just have an extra level of creepiness, and tragedy from dying at such a young age. Lucy's story is a dark one, as she acted under the influence of a demon, which led to her ripping off her own jaw, and dying from blood loss, and this is reflected in her ghostly appearance, which elevates her to new heights of horror.

5 Jimmy Stone (Silent Hill 4: The Room)

The First Victim is the Most Intimidating

Silent Hill 4: The Room
9.3 /10
Released
September 7, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Team Silent
Platform(s)
PC, PS2, Xbox (Original)
Powered by

One day, ordinary man Henry Townshend finds himself inexplicably locked in his apartment, as a heavy padlock and chains prevent his escape. A hole appears in his bathroom wall large enough for him to crawl through, leading him into a nightmareish otherworld. Along with the monsters of this world, Henry also has to contend with hauntings in his apartment, as this game has its fair share of ghosts, one such being Jimmy Stone.

The first of Walter's victims for the 21 Sacraments ritual is Jimmy Stone, who is the poster-ghost of the game. His heavy marketing did little to lessen his impact in the game, as his undeadly visage is still a grim sight, and the fact he can appear in Henry's apartment and the otherworld means there is no escaping this horrifying ghost.

4 Laura (The Evil Within)

This Long-Legged Creature is a Tough and Terrifying Boss Monster

The Evil Within
5 /10
7.8 /10
Released
October 14, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Tango Gameworks
Platform(s)
Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

The Evil Within was one of the most anticipated games of 2014, having the mind of Shinji Makima behind it, who had previously worked on the Resident Evil franchise. Playing as Sebastian Castellanos, the player travels to Beacon Mental Hospital, where a mass murder took place. Upon arrival, Sebastian and his colleagues, Joseph and Juli, are thrown into a nightmarish other world, populated by numerous horrific creatures.

One of the most iconic and frightening monsters in the game is Laura, a reincarnation of the central antagonist's dead sister, which lands her squarely in the ghost territory. Her spider-like limbs which she has in spades, makes her truly unsettling to behold, especially when she uses them to quickly crawl right in the direction of the player, and her Sadako-esque looks is just the scary cherry on this horror cake.

3 Lisa (P.T.)

Though a Tragic Figure, Lisa is One of the Scariest Horror Game Monsters of Recent Years

Silent Hills
Survival Horror
Systems
ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Kojima Productions
Publisher(s)
Konami

Platform(s)
PS4
Powered by

Silent Hills was a promised return to the long-dormant franchise, which was reduced to merchandise and pachinko machines for the longest time. This game promised a return to the fabled city, bringing in the acting talent of Norman Reedus as the role of the playable character. Rather than just giving players a trailer and calling it a day, Konami and Kojima gave players a playable teaser, literally dubbed P.T. , free of charge.

Looping through the same hallway as a story of a family tragedy slowly comes into focus, players have the misfortune of meeting one of the murder-suicide victims, known only as Lisa. Seemingly staggeringly tall, making odd choking and gurgling noises and wearing a very unsettling grin, Lisa is nothing short of absolutely terrifying, and players want nothing more than to stay far, far away, though most had the misfortune of dying to her in an equally disturbing death scene.

2 Sae Kurosawa (Fatal Frame 2: Crimson Butterfly)

The Scene of Her in a Room Full of Bodies is an Image That Cannot Be Forgotten

Fatal Frame 2: Crimson Butterly
Survival Horror
Systems
Released
December 10, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M
Developer(s)
Tecmo
Platform(s)
PS2, PS3, Wii, Xbox (Original)
Powered by

There is no shortage of scary ghosts in the Fatal Frame games, as the entire series revolves around the player character finding the camera obscura and using it to capture ghosts, particularly the dangerous ones that attack indiscriminately. In the second game, twins Mio and Mayu find themselves in the Lost Village, a place that exists on top of the hell mouth, the villagers appease through a sacrificial ritual involving twins.

One of the victims of the ritual, Sae Kurosawa, is one of the most infamous ghosts not just in Fatal Frame 2 , but the series as a whole. That one scene of her laughing maniacally in the midst of a bloodbath with the Kusabi materializing behind her is one that branded itself into the memories of all who played just because of how frightening it is. This alone marks Sae as one of the scariest ghosts in all of horror gaming.

1 Alma Wade (F.E.A.R. Series)

This Spirit is Gifted with Dangerous Amounts of Power

F.E.A.R.
7.8 /10
Released
October 18, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Monolith Productions
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
Powered by

F.E.A.R. (First Encounter Assault Recon) is by far one of the most successful and well-known horror trilogies, always tasking one unlucky soldier with taking point, and they normally have the misfortune of meeting the poster child of the series: Alma Wade.

Though not a ghost by the term's technical definition , she is still worthy of a mention as she does share some similarities, such as her ability to just appear and disappear as she pleases, and being impervious to most forms of harm. She has powerful psychic abilities that landed her the unfortunate position of being a lab rat, and that has royally peeved her off to the point she lashes out at any who gets close. Her deadly nature, armed with her terrifying forms as either a grown woman or a creepy little girl, crowns her as the scariest ghost in all of gaming.
